events.target_title: Add pollable GInputStream/GOutputStream around stdin/stdout/stderr

note.body: To add a usecase: I'm writing [nvim-rs](https://github.com/KillTheMule/nvim-rs), a library for writing [neovim](https://neovim.io/) rpc clients. I'm adding support for using glib/gio for the eventloop, and rpc plugins connect via stdio. As a comparison, GUI clients connect via stdio to a child process, which already works nicely via e.g. [g-subprocess-get-stdin-pipe](https://developer.gnome.org/gio/stable/GSubprocess.html#g-subprocess-get-stdin-pipe).

events.target_title: Add pollable GInputStream/GOutputStream around stdin/stdout/stderr

note.body:
> As a comparison, GUI clients connect via stdio to a child process, which already works nicely via e.g. [g-subprocess-get-stdin-pipe](https://developer.gnome.org/gio/stable/GSubprocess.html#g-subprocess-get-stdin-pipe). 

I'll have to take that back, on windows those types aren't pollable. Works on linux, though.

No, unfortunately I have not had time to test that suggestion yet, I still have to try building Evolution at all. This *is* my intent but I have tons of other things to do unfortunately.

I think it is less of a problem that some things would be hidden in the date selector, since there is a possibility to select date using the toolbar too. It would be much simpler to have a partially visible date selector than having to remove the sidebar altogether (press F9) to enable maximize-right. 

Incidentally, the intended behavior after fixing the GNOME Shell bug is already available: press F9, maximize-right, F9.

I'll do what I can but I doubt I can spend more time on this for at least a week. (I first need to find the definition of the widget. After having tried building myself.) (edit: add keypresses)

Unfortunately, I have the same problem with Deja Dup from snap (v40.6) on Linux Mint 18.3. First, I installed Deja Dup from apt and everything works, but it was a old version, so I switched to snap - and this cannot understand duplicity version.

There is one hint: when starting from terminal, before this error there is a log 
`python3: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version GLIBC_2.25 not found (required by python3)`

So I suppose that the problem is with python that runs on my machine (because Deja Dup snap doesn't provide own version of python, right?)

events.target_title: add prefix to duplicity to extend the command

note.body:
This is so good improvement, but in my opinion*, injecting raw prefix by env isn't the best solution. Rather as for me, let's Deja Dup having own settings specifically to limiting bandwidth based on `nice` or `trickle`  (or simply injecting prefix). Anyway, it could be a few settings/variants for both or more, and single place where prefix will be build from all possibilities. 

Limiting bandwidth is so useful feature and I dare say it could in future come as setting configurable by UI. 

\* To be clear, I'm not from this project's team or any GNOME-project.

events.target_title: canterell-fonts v0.201
canterell-fonts v0.201

note.body:
Prior to updating manjaro VM yesterday the default font which is set to "Cantarell Regular 10" (never changed) was displayed as a regular font in double commander and konsole.  The cantarell-fonts package prior to installion was version 1:0.111-1.   The update included cantarell-fonts package version 1:0.201-1.  After the installation text started looking bold.  No changes to default font setting were made and it is still set to "Cantarell Regular 10".

To illustrate better, I'm attaching screenshots. They are divided into 3 categories: before, during and after the installation.

Hopefully I've provided enough information. If you need more let me know.

Thanks!

Before installation:

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_pamac](/uploads/1f7f80967e38c60c0bdf914b216fef81/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_pamac.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_fonts_settings](/uploads/0f0547909c5c229e82f366f91e1ce1db/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_fonts_settings.png)

As you can see file names and folder names appear completely normal.

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_double_commander](/uploads/7e9a59b493310cf2eb7d151f7249f2de/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_double_commander.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_konsole_config](/uploads/10e2ba5516eb667dbd38e913f1f6ed39/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.111-1_konsole_config.png)

During installation:

And here are some anomalies I noticed while during the font package installation. These were cleared by restarting pamac.

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation1](/uploads/ad564e53264a96f4608c08054bb11484/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation1.png)

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation2](/uploads/5de7bc2bcb8a78875f0189fed53175a8/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation2.png)

![manjaro_vm_during_font_installation3](/uploads/f5de2a4515f1d6662f61def77e773a08/manjaro_vm_during_font_installation3.png)

After the installation:
After VM reboot file names and folder names in double commander as well as menu labels under konsole preferences display in bold.  This is while the font settings still show "Cantarell Regular 10". I doubt this was an intentional change.

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_font_settings](/uploads/a5dafb4f3b80b4f5fd6c9b204ee95262/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_font_settings.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_pamac](/uploads/83fd883823bb7c579f37b24fc452423b/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_pamac.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_double_commander](/uploads/75fd33fe2900edc2e7482c6856d0edf2/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_double_commander.png)

![manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_konsole_config](/uploads/c0b6e82db70e75bc891e78845e64f981/manjaro_vm_cantarell-fonts_1_0.201-1_konsole_config.png)

events.target_title: canterell-fonts v0.201

note.body:
Yes it's a Qt5 issue only GTK version of double commander is fine. Deleting Cantarell-VF.otf does fix the problem.  Also I did notice that the issue is with the Cantarell bold font, not the regular as I said initially.  Double commander uses cantarell bold 10 as a main font by default. It looks like the bold font got a lot bolder with v0.201 update.  For my situation I could just change the font to regular in double commander or as you mentioned delete Cantarell-VF.otf file. I don't like either of these options since: 

 * a) I have to apply either fix to over a dozen VMs 
 * b) If I delete Cantarell-VF.otf file a new update will simply put it back and I'll have to delete it again... 
 * c) If I fix it in double commander it may not be fixed in other applications.  

So it would be very useful to know if this change was intentional or not? If not will this issue be fixed in the next update?
Thank you!

events.target_title: canterell-fonts v0.201

note.body:
I searched before reporting the problem and saw nothing recent. The theme/style I'm using under Qt5 config is cleanlooks.  I tried several other available themes and it appears theme selection does not affect font boldness.

Qt5 - 5.14.0-3
FreeType2 - 2.10.1-1

Filenames starting with a digit are stored percent encoded in xmlDoc.URL
Filenames starting with a digit are stored percent encoded in xmlDoc.URL

note.body: It clearly isn't as I've shown, otherwise it wouldn't return the same URL for two different files.

events.target_title: Filenames starting with a digit are stored percent encoded in xmlDoc.URL

note.body: Or to make it even clearer: if both files `1:b.xml` and `1%3Ab.xml` exist, `doc->URL` for both returns `1%3Ab.xml`, so you can't tell which one of them was opened.

events.target_title: pdf files are rendered but not printed

note.body:
I have a very similar situation, I use Ubuntu 19.10 with Evince 3.34.1 and a new Epson ET-2720 printer.
The Epson prints: Test pages, office documents and PDFs printed with LibreOffice Draw. If I send PDFs to the printer with Evince, Ubuntu will state the print job has been sent to the printer, the Epson printer indicates it receives the document, tries to processes it, then stops abruptly, finally Ubuntu states the print job has completed.
I also have an older HP OfficeJet Pro 8710. If I use Evince to sent the same test PDFs to this printer it is capable of processing and printing the information Evince generated.
These events are a strong indication that Evince unsuccessfully implements some printing standards.

boxes crashes (SIGSEGV) upon startup

note.body:
I have possibly a similar issue running gnome-boxes on Ubuntu 19.10 with Plasma.

Launching gnome-boxes, the main window opens and show a loading animation, then after a few seconds it crashes.

Running in the console I get this output:

```
$ gnome-boxes

(gnome-boxes:29184): Gtk-WARNING **: 11:32:42.048: GtkFlowBox with a model will ignore sort and filter functions

(gnome-boxes:29184): Gtk-WARNING **: 11:32:42.049: GtkListBox with a model will ignore sort and filter functions

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:45.344: util-app.vala:178: Failed to find OS with id: 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6': Unknown OS ID 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6'

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:45.351: util-app.vala:178: Failed to find OS with id: 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6': Unknown OS ID 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6'

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:45.465: util-app.vala:178: Failed to find OS with id: 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6': Unknown OS ID 'http://endlessos.com/eos/3.6'

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.125: libvirt-machine.vala:83: Failed to disable 3D Acceleration

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.134: libvirt-broker.vala:66: Failed to update domain 'ubuntu18.10-3': Failed to set domain configuration: XML error: Invalid PCI address 0000:04:00.0. slot must be >= 1

(gnome-boxes:29184): Libvirt.GObject-CRITICAL **: 11:32:46.902: gvir_storage_vol_get_path: assertion 'GVIR_IS_STORAGE_VOL(vol)' failed

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.906: libvirt-machine.vala:83: Failed to disable 3D Acceleration

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.913: libvirt-broker.vala:66: Failed to update domain 'ubuntu18.10-3-2': Failed to set domain configuration: XML error: Invalid PCI address 0000:04:00.0. slot must be >= 1

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-WARNING **: 11:32:46.914: libvirt-broker.vala:159: Failed to find source machine of clone develop 1201

(gnome-boxes:29184): Boxes-CRITICAL **: 11:32:46.914: boxes_vm_importer_get_source_media: assertion 'self != NULL' failed
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

Using gdb on the resulting core shows this:

```
Core was generated by `gnome-boxes'.
Program terminated with signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
#0  0x00005630b133e52a in boxes_libvirt_broker_real_add_source_co (_data_=0x5630b2f680e0) at src/25a6634@@gnome-boxes@exe/libvirt-broker.c:1879
1879    src/25a6634@@gnome-boxes@exe/libvirt-broker.c: No such file or directory.
[Current thread is 1 (Thread 0x7feaba067d80 (LWP 29184))]
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00005630b133e52a in boxes_libvirt_broker_real_add_source_co (_data_=0x5630b2f680e0) at src/25a6634@@gnome-boxes@exe/libvirt-broker.c:1879
#1  0x00005630b133c606 in boxes_libvirt_broker_try_add_existing_domain_async_ready_wrapper
    (source_object=0x5630b23ccd10 [BoxesLibvirtBroker], res=0x7fea4000cef0, user_data=user_data@entry=0x5630b2f680e0) at src/25a6634@@gnome-boxes@exe/libvirt-broker.c:1333
#2  0x00007feac5426029 in g_task_return_now (task=0x7fea4000cef0 [GTask]) at ../../../gio/gtask.c:1212
```

removing `~/.cache/gnome-boxes` and `~/.config/gnome-boxes` makes it crash faster, without any change in the gdb back trace or console output.

removing `~/.config/libvirt` and `~/.cache/libvirt` causes gnome-boxes to load properly.

Is there anything I, as a normal end user with some basic programming skills, can do to give this more traction? This bug has been reported multiple times since gnome got wayland support.
This is the first one, I think: [https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=739718](https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=739718)

I would love to help out. This is basically all that's keeping me from moving to wayland.

events.target_title: spinning-globe does't work

note.body:
*Windows 10, Gimp 2.10.14*

Is there a fix I should be downloading somewhere in the git tree? 

I looked at #4331 and it looked like that issue was fixed in 2.10.14 which is the version I'm seeing this error on. E.g. it seems as if it's broken in the current release as well.

Just in case it might help, I'm adding the specific error message:

*Filters>Animation>Spinning Globe...*

```
GIMP Message
Plug-in crashed: "map-object.exe"
(C:\Program Files\GIMP 2\lib\gimp\2.0\plug-ins\map-object\map-object.exe)

The dying plug-in may have messed up GIMP's internal state. You may want to save your images and restart GIMP to be on the safe side.

Spinning Globe Message
Error while executing script-fu-spinning-globe:

Error: Procedure execution of plug-in-map-object failed on invalid input arguments: Procedure 'plug-in-map-object' returned no return values 
```

I can also run any debug you might need if you cannot duplicate the behavior.

events.target_title: Crash when using with Sourcetree DIFF in 3.20: Cannot import gi / Cannot import GTK+: The specific module could not be found

note.body: Confirming that the latest pipeline worked for me. I was running 3.20.0 previously and had this issue.

events.target_title: Wrong time(zone?) in calendar events

note.body:
```
$ gnome-calendar --version
gnome-calendar: Version 3.34.2
$ pacman -Q libical
libical 3.0.7-1
```

Calendar with this issue: https://filmkreis.de/kalender

This calendar uses the `X-WR-TIMEZONE` property.

My timezone is Europe/Berlin (CET). The events on Tuesdays and Thursdays start at 20:00 hours but are displayed at 21:00 hours.

If I change the timezone to EET the event is displayed at 22:00 hours. If I change the timezone to GMT the event is displayed at 20:00 hours.

To me this appears to be an off-by-one error. The event should always be displayed one hour earlier than it actually is.

events.target_title: Perspective transform of selection incorrectly applies to whole image when layer group is selected

note.body:
Hi, I'd like to see this re-opened, as I am experiencing the same issue with the scale transformation tool.

Select layer group at head.
Rectangular select a region.
Apply scale transformation.

RESULT: Entire layer group is scaled

EXPECTED: Selected region in all layers in group is scaled, the rest of the image in all other layers is unmodified.

events.target_title: Scale transform of selection incorrectly applies to whole image when layer group is selected

events.target_title: GIMP 2.10.14 not loading HEIC files on ubuntu
Could g_get_user_database_entry() and friends be moved to their own file for the benefit of statically linked applications?
automatically switch to 8 Bit integer when changing mode to indexed
Wacom Bamboo Pen & Touch doesn't get detected as an input device.

note.body:
Resolved for me the same problem with complete deinstallation of:
Wacom-driver Version 6.3.38-2.
Tablet WACOM Intuos pro PTH-660. 
Gimp 64bit 2.10.14
Next step:
new installation of WACOM driver Version 6.3.38-2.
new installation of Gimp 64bit 2.10.14

Now Gimp and Krita have access to the pressure sensitive WACOM Pen in the input devices. please enable them if necessary.

The original source of this issue is the continous update of Windows 10 and all drivers. it looks like overwritten files inside the system. may also be, that the used Tablet API for Windows 10 is now deprecated. for example the Corel Painter Essentials 4 was working without my modifications. WACOM has currently 2 pressure sensitivity levels. one (the old compatibility mode) is restricted to 1024 digits. the second is the new introduced pressure sensitivity with more digits (range is unknown for me).

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
Never had an issue with this in 2.10.8 then when I installed 2.10.14 today it started happening to me, but even more when I uninstall 2.10.14 and reinstall 2.10.8 the latter doesn't even load, but crashes as soon as it tries to open.

Afterwords I only got 2.10.8 to work again by deleting all GIMP files I could find, .gimp-2.8, the GIMP folder in AppData/Roaming, and all GIMP, GeGL, Babl, gtk data in AppData/Local, so it starts right now, but it now also produces the same fatal error while proceeding to edit->preferences, while before it wouldn't!

Is anyone aware of more GIMP produced folders I can delete? Or maybe even tell me how to manually search for any registries to even delete those, like Gegl, Bable registries if they exist? 
I also find that GIMP has saved my project history, so there are some preferences still being preserved somewhere.

Much thanks in advance.

Update:
Also exporting images fails right now, this is quite an evil bug.

events.target_title: Gimp crash on Edit-> Preferences

note.body:
I've looked into the registry entries that are blatantly GIMP's and I found a lot, even for the old 2.8 version. I've run CCleaner on the registries a few times actually to get rid of as much as I can, the free version of CCleaner doesn't seem to recognize all of them in one scan. 
I got rid of most of them, but I was left with this one:

![HKEY_USERS1](/uploads/00c765e82407efd4860b5bac88a5dd43/HKEY_USERS1.png)

Also GIMP has still got my document history saved some where and I can't figure out where, and the uninstall doesn't delete any of this data.

events.target_title: The exact names of the icon files.
acer monitor cycles inputs and then turns back on instead of going to sleep after "blank screen" time is reached
XF86Copy XF86Paste keys do nothing

note.body:
@jayarmstrong Would you mind sharing your Actiona script here? I'm affected by the same issue and I'm having a hard time to find an easy solution.

In any case I'm actually quite surprised that this is still a quirk in GTK in 2020. I remember this was already a bummer back in 2005. Is it really that much work to make use the XFxxx-Keys in GTK? There are so many applications that would benefit from working cut, copy and paste special keys.
